sentences.english: My daughter Eliot performed a supervisory role during the construction
sentences.chinese: 我女兒Eliot在建造過程中起監工的作用。

sentences.english: But even at work he was the task-master in absentia .
sentences.chinese: 即便外出，他也是個缺席監工。

sentences.english: The overlooker has to overlook a large number of employees.
The supervisor of the workers dismissed the salesman's claims.
sentences.chinese: 監工回絕了銷售員的要求。

sentences.english: Recognize that business is a cruel taskmaster.
sentences.chinese: 認識到業務是個殘酷的監工。

sentences.english: But even at work he was the task-master in absentia.
sentences.chinese: 即使外出，他也是個缺席監工。

sentences.english: One of the supervisors, age 14, is accused of beating workers with whips.
sentences.chinese: 其中一位被指控用鞭子抽打工人的監工，年僅14歲。

sentences.english: He is an experienced foreman and is in charge of three work teams.
sentences.chinese: 他是個經驗老道的監工，管理三個工隊。

sentences.english: I whispered to my brother as the slavedriver passed by.
sentences.chinese: 我悄聲告訴大哥，可不巧，這時候監工經過。

sentences.english: A welding overseer picks up$ 400a week.
sentences.chinese: 電焊工監工每週掙400英鎊。

definition: internal affairs/domestic affairs/family affairs/(trad.) affairs within the palace
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
Zhou Ji (1781-1839), Qing writer and poet
help to the needy/emergency relief/charity/to give to poorer relative/(also 賙濟|赒济)
to be transferred to another post/to post away
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
to put down in writing/to take down notes/transcript/record
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
to relieve sb of his post/to sack/to demote/dismissal/sacking
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
